FeModel¶

class +AMrotorSIM.+Rotor.+FEMRotor.@FeModel.FeModel(a)¶

Bases: sphinxcontrib.mat_types.handle

FeModel Class which included the finite element model

See also AMrotorSIM.Rotor AMrotorSIM.Rotor.FEMRotor.Element

name = None¶

Config-struct

geometry = None¶

See also AMrotorSIM.Rotor.FEMRotor.Material

material = None¶

See also AMrotorSIM.Rotor.FEMRotor.Mesh

mesh = None¶

mass

damping_matrix = None¶

damping

gyroscopic_matrix = None¶

gyroscopic, must be weighted with the rotational speed Omega, M*xdd+(C+Omega*G)*xd+K*x=f

stiffness_matrix = None¶

stiffness

+AMrotorSIM.+Rotor.+FEMRotor.@FeModel.assemble_fem(self)¶
+AMrotorSIM.+Rotor.+FEMRotor.@FeModel.check_rigidbody(self)¶
+AMrotorSIM.+Rotor.+FEMRotor.@FeModel.create_mesh(self, mesh_opt, Geometry, material)¶
+AMrotorSIM.+Rotor.+FEMRotor.@FeModel.find_node_nr(self, position)¶
+AMrotorSIM.+Rotor.+FEMRotor.@FeModel.get_distance_node_desired_position(rotor, desiredPos)¶

GET_DISTANCE_NODE_DESIRED_POSITION - get the distance of the closest node to the desired node [delta,nodePos]=get_distance_node_desired_position(rotor,desiredPos) Get the distance between a desired position on the rotor and the nearest node of the finite element discretisation.

+AMrotorSIM.+Rotor.+FEMRotor.@FeModel.get_dof_no(rotor, nodeNo)¶

GET_DOF_NO - get the dofs of selected nodes dofNo= get_dof_no(rotor,nodeNo) Get the numbers of all degrees of freedom, that correspond to the node numbers.

+AMrotorSIM.+Rotor.+FEMRotor.@FeModel.get_gdof(self, direction, Node, varargin)¶

get_gdof - get global degree of freedom glob_dof = get_gdof(self,direction,Node,varargin)

direction: ‘u_x’,’u_y’,’u_z’,’psi_x’,’psi_y’,’psi_z’ node: number of desired node varargin: A -> system matrix in state space

+AMrotorSIM.+Rotor.+FEMRotor.@FeModel.get_mass(self)¶
+AMrotorSIM.+Rotor.+FEMRotor.@FeModel.get_node_no(rotor, position)¶

GET_NODE_NO - Get the node number that is closest to the desired position. nodeNo = get_node_no(rotor,position)

+AMrotorSIM.+Rotor.+FEMRotor.@FeModel.get_node_position(rotor, nodeNo)¶

GET_NODE_POSITION - Get the corresponding position to a node number. nodePos = get_node_position(rotor,nodeNo)

+AMrotorSIM.+Rotor.+FEMRotor.@FeModel.show_2D(self, varargin)¶

compare discretisation with user input geometry
